sub_topic: Finding the cross product of two vectors using trigonometry
message_1: A math student is asked to find the cross product of two vectors ğš and ğ›, where ğš = <3, -2, 1> and ğ› = <2, 4, -3>. Using trigonometry, what is the value of ğš Ã— ğ›?
message_2:
To find the cross product of two vectors ğš and ğ›, we can use the following formula:

ğš Ã— ğ› = <a2b3 - a3b2, a3b1 - a1b3, a1b2 - a2b1>

where ğš = <a1, a2, a3> and ğ› = <b1, b2, b3>.

Given ğš = <3, -2, 1> and ğ› = <2, 4, -3>, we can plug in the values into the formula:

ğš Ã— ğ› = <(-2)(-3) - (1)(4), (1)(2) - (3)(-3), (3)(4) - (-2)(2)>

ğš Ã— ğ› = <6 - 4, 2 + 9, 12 + 4>

ğš Ã— ğ› = <2, 11, 16>

So, the cross product of ğš and ğ› is <2, 11, 16>.
